intro: Eurya handel-mazzettii, commonly known as the Chinese huckleberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to eastern Asia, particularly China, where it grows in temperate forests and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of bright red berries that ripen in the fall. It is often found in shaded, moist environments and can thrive in acidic soils. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various wildlife species.
